words.def: a long narrow furrow cut either by a natural process (such as erosion) or by a tool (as e.g. a groove in a phonograph record)
a small growth of trees without underbrush
move about aimlessly or without any destination, often in search of food or employment
(cricket) the division of play during which six balls are bowled at the batsman by one player from the other team from the same end of the pitch
(used as a sentence connector) therefore or consequently
a cruel wicked and inhuman person
Vice President of the United States under Bill Clinton (born in 1948)
someone who leaves
edible seeds or roots or stems or leaves or bulbs or tubers or nonsweet fruits of any of numerous herbaceous plant
rate of revolution of a motor
A narrow sea inlet, particularly in the Shetland Islands, similar to a fjord.
an inflated feeling of pride in your superiority to others
a cgs unit of work or energy
any thick, viscous matter
A hard surface of rock fragments set in a sandy matrix, found in some hot deserts.
fish eggs or egg-filled ovary
City in Burkina Faso (Proper noun)
a mineral that contains metal that is valuable enough to be mined
a time for working (after which you will be relieved by someone else)
a rare heavy polyvalent metallic element that resembles manganese chemically and is used in some alloys
a state in northwestern United States on the Pacific
A small island.
a trivalent metallic element of the rare earth group
